Key Match Events: Deni Avdija scored 26 points, leading the Trail Blazers to a 119-100 victory over the Pelicans.
Shaedon Sharpe added 21 points for the Trail Blazers.
Portland led wire to wire, building a 16-point lead in the first quarter and never being threatened.
Anfernee Simons scored 17 points and Toumani Camara 15 for Portland.
Deandre Ayton scored 11 points and grabbed 13 rebounds for the Blazers.
CJ McCollum scored 23 points and Dejounte Murray 20 for New Orleans.
Pelicans forward Herb Jones left the game in the third quarter due to a right shoulder injury.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Portland shot 67.4% (31 of 46) through the first 24 minutes, setting a season high for a first half with 75 points.
New Orleans played without Zion Williamson and Brandon Ingram due to injuries.
